meanings.definition: The act of coming into contact or touching.
meanings.sent1: The gentle appulse of the two hands was a sign of friendship.
meanings.sent2: The appulse of the two cars caused a minor collision.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected appulse of the two dogs led to a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The appulse of the waves against the shore was soothing.
meanings.sent5: The appulse of the sun on her skin felt warm and comforting.

meanings.definition: The closest approach of one celestial body to another in the sky.
meanings.sent1: The appulse of the moon and the stars was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers eagerly awaited the appulse of the comet and the planet.
meanings.sent3: The appulse of the shooting star and the moon made for a magical night.
meanings.sent4: The appulse of the meteor and the asteroid was a celestial dance.
meanings.sent5: The appulse of the planets in the night sky was a rare event.

meanings.definition: A point of contact or touching.
meanings.sent1: The appulse of the pen on the paper created a beautiful drawing.
meanings.sent2: The appulse of the two wires caused a spark.
meanings.sent3: The appulse of the brush on the canvas brought the painting to life.
meanings.sent4: The appulse of the fingertips on the piano keys produced a melodious sound.
meanings.sent5: The appulse of the puzzle pieces completed the picture.
